citation.article-title: Two novel psychrotolerant species, Bacillus psychrotolerans sp. nov. and Bacillus psychrodurans sp. nov., which contain ornithine in their cell walls.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus psychrodurans sp. nov.
Bacillus psychrodurans (psy.chro.dur'ans. Gr. adj. psychros cold; L. pres. part. durans enduring; N.L. part. adj. psychrodurans colD-enduring)
Cells are Gram-positive (according to KOH and aminopeptidase test).
Cell width, 0.5-0.6 μm; cell length, 2-5 μm.
Spores predominantly round on CASO agar and predominantly ellipsoid on Difco marine agar; located terminally (spores observed only with type strain).
The diamino acid in position 3 of the peptidoglycan side chain is ornithine, and glutamic acid forms an interpeptide bridge.
Does not grow (or only very poorly) in/on nutrient broth or nutrient agar.
Good growth in/on CASO broth or agar.
Lower temperature limit for growth: -2°C up to 0°C (type strain).
Upper temperature limit for growth: 30°C (type strain) up to 35°C.
No growth in the presence of lysozyme.
Growth at 3%NaCl and usually at 5%NaCl positive (with 5% NaCl one of the four strains tested negative); no growth at 7% NaCl.
Acid production from D-glucose, L-arabinose, D-xylose and dmannitol usually negative or only weak (two of the four strains tested, including the type strain, positive with D-glucose and D-mannitol).
Usually hydrolysis of gelatin (one of the four strains tested negative).
Hydrolysis of Tween 20, 40, 60 and usually of Tween 80 positive (with Tween 80 type strain negative).
Isolated from garden soil, EL-Kanater, Egypt.
G+C content of the DNA is 36-37 mol% (Bd) with 36.3% for the type strain.
